traffic

Class EdgeOfMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • traffic.EdgeOfMap
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Connectable, Connection

    public class EdgeOfMap
extends java.lang.Object
implements Connectable, Connection
    This object implements what happens to lanes at the edge of a map. Inbound lanes get random vehicles. Outbound lanes lose their oldest vehicle. You may use multiple instances of this class but you don't have to. It's designed such that any number of Connectable objects may take Vehicles from a single instance and that same single instance will consume Vehicles from all Connection objects that are connected to any instance.
    Version:
    2018093000
    Author:
    Richard Barton

    • Method Detail

      • vehiclesGoTo

        public void vehiclesGoTo(Connectable outgoingTo,
                         char heading,
                         int outgoingLane,
                         int incomingLane)
        Give the Connectable object at the edge of the map a place from which to get Vehicles. We don't care about outgoing lanes because we just provide pseudo-randomly created Vehicles.
        Specified by:
        vehiclesGoTo in interface Connectable
        Parameters:
        outgoingTo - The inbound Connectable object at the edge of the map.
        heading - The direction in which Vehicles travel.
        outgoingLane - We ignore this.
        incomingLane - We have to pass this to the Connectable object taking Vehicles in case it has multiple lanes.

      • setConnection

        public void setConnection(Connection incoming,
                          char heading,
                          int lane)
        Give the Connectable object at the edge of the map some place for their outgoing Vehicles to go. We don't care about incoming lanes because we just consume Vehicles.
        Specified by:
        setConnection in interface Connectable
        Parameters:
        incoming - The Connection object from which we'll take Vehicles.
        heading - We ignore this.
        lane - We ignore this.

      • tick

        public static void tick()
        Take a vehicle from all of the objects connected to any instance of this class.

      • takeVehicle

        public Vehicle takeVehicle()
        Description copied from interface: Connection
        The takeVehicle method removes a Vehicle from this object. Since no Vehicle should be in more than one place at a time, the Vehicle being returned must be completely removed from this object.
        Specified by:
        takeVehicle in interface Connection
        Returns:
        A pseudo-randomly chosen subclass of Vehicle.
